result.execSummary:
The defendant Nakeya J Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete an AODA assessment and complete an follow up treatment recommended.

DE will complete intensive out patient treatment.

DE will maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. 

DE will have no association with individuals known to use, possess, distribute/transport illegal substances or be involved in illegal drug activity. 

DE will not possess syringes unless medically required to do so.

DE must obtain her GED.

DE must obtain a valid operating privilege.

DE will have no contact with Mason Deridder.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.

Phone may be released to DE.

2022GF75 WAS CONSOLIDATED INTO 2022CF82.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

timeConds.notes: 4 months of conditional jail time ordered if needed during probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nakeya J Hall

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Annette M Barna in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nakeya J Hall in court.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Nakeya J Hall.   All cases heard together 21CF35, 20CF100, and 22CF82.  
22CF82 set for PH.  Court informed DE rights as to PH.   DE understands and waived PH.  Court reviewed CC and found PC to bind DE over for trial.  Ct. 1 Amended to Poss. with intent to deliver a controlled substance, namely: Methamphetamine, as a repeater, Class E. Felony.   DE entered a No Contest plea to the amended charge.  Court read joint recommendation as to sentence.   Court accepted the NC plea and found DE guilty.  Court informed DE max. penalty increased due to repeater enh.   DE acknowledged her prior conviction and that it was unreversed.
20CF100 and 21CF35:  DAGP revoked.  DE entered NC pleas to operating without a valid license in both cases.  Both parties argued sentence.
Court informed DE of her rights.   Court found DE guilty and imposed Court costs on the traffic offenses.  
Both parties argued sentence on revocation in 20CF100 and 21CF35.      DE made a statement to the Court.      
Court ordered sentence as jointly recommended by parties and Court ordered 8 months jail on both cases  concurrent (20CF100 and 21CF35).  Huber is granted.   She can go to another jail as long as they can take them and there is no cost to Rusk County.   Court ordered 4 mos. jail as a condition of probation in 22CF35.   This will allow probation agent to use that jail time should it be necessary.   
Court ordered 133 days jail credit on 20CF100 and 128 days jail credit on 21CF35.
Parties jointly recommend her phone in possession of law enf. can be released to DE.  
Costs reduced to judgment.

Adj. 3:19 PM
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Nakeya J Hall appeared by video means with Attorney.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE currently on a probaton hold, awiting a revocation hearing scheduled in May.  DE/Atty will waive TL for PH.  Court instructs on waiver of TL.  DE understands waiver of TL, Court will accpet waiver.  Set for PH June 3, 2022 @ 11:30am. Adj 3:03pm
